alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 9:55AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CHERRY... NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND KEYA PAHA COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 AM CDT... At 955 AM CDT, the public reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Keyapaha to near Valentine. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Springview, Johnstown, Norden, Wood Lake, Burton, Nets Peak, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Meadville, North River Trail, Sparks, Smith Falls State Park, and Antelope Peak. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 209 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 198 and 233. Highway 97 near mile marker 138. Highway 83 between mile markers 203 and 207. Highway 12 between mile markers 2 and 5, and between mile markers 9 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
